concept.title: Import WMF Files
concept.shortdesc: As a Windows metafile format, WMF files are frequently used to produce clip art and other non-technical images that you need for drawings. Use WMFIN or IMPORT command to insert a WMF file into a drawing file as a block.

conbody.p: To be different from bitmaps, WMF files contain vector information that can be resized and printed without losing resolution. If 2D solids or wide lines are contained in the WMF file, turn off their display so as to increase drawing speed.

Both vector and raster information can be contained in WMF files. However, ZWCAD uses only the vector information from a WMF file. ZWCAD ignores the raster information if using a WMF file containing raster information.
